plants.germinationNeeds: Best grown from grafted rootstock, not seed. Plant bare-root trees in spring. Requires a chilling period to set fruit.
plants.optimalConditions: Full sun. Well-drained, fertile loam. Needs cross-pollination from another compatible apple variety.

plants.germinationNeeds: Best grown from bare-root runners or small plants in spring or autumn. Seeds are difficult and slow.
plants.optimalConditions: Full sun. Well-drained, sandy soil rich in organic matter. Keep beds weed-free and mulch to protect fruit.

plants.germinationNeeds: Plant young bushes in spring. Requires acidic soil (pH 4.5-5.5). Two different varieties are needed for good pollination.
plants.optimalConditions: Full sun. Acidic, moist, well-drained, organic-rich soil. Mulch with pine needles or peat moss.

plants.germinationNeeds: Best grown from canes. Plant in early spring. Spreads via underground runners.
plants.optimalConditions: Full sun. Rich, well-drained soil. Provide support like a trellis or wires. Prune annually.

plants.germinationNeeds: Best grown from a grafted tree from a nursery. Requires a chilling period. Plant in spring.
plants.optimalConditions: Full sun. Deep, fertile, well-drained soil. Good air circulation is important to prevent disease.

history.notes: Planning to plant a 'Bing' cherry tree.
